posts.post_content:
GREAT card.  
Even if you dont win, it keeps your opponent on edge wondering whats going to be flipped from your deck. The emotional torment alone to your opponents is worth putting a couple of these in your deck.  
I tossed in some Underworld Dreams, Pestilence and Curse of Wizardry for some added fun.

Posted By: Kryptnyt (7/29/2011 4:52:54 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This is still bad for Casual or EDH! For seven mana, you could play something like Blatant Thievery and immediately take charge of the board. But with this, you're bound to one activation per turn, and you're only attacking life totals. On top of that, you are attacking them with a random value. Sure, you could try and manipulate the top card of your library, but the rewards are still minimal. The best you can do is still only 16 in one shot, and that requires the inclusion of often-dead cards in your deck. Maybe if you got to Scry before the activation, and then only maybe would I even try to play this in EDH or Multiplayer. I've had others play this against me, and it always seems like too little, too late.
posts.html:
